item.title: Michael Baggot - Theories of Consciousness
item.author: Closer To Truth
item.content:encoded:
Get member exclusives like early access to new content with a free Closer To Truth account: https://closertotruth.com/
Explore diverse theories of consciousness including materialism, dualism, panpsychism, idealism and diverse ways of thinking about consciousness from the perspectives of neuroscience, philosophy, wisdom traditions. Compare and contrast diverse theories of consciousness as they are arrayed on a “Landscape of Consciousness”.
Make a tax-deductible donation of any amount to help us continue exploring the world's deepest questions: https://closertotruth.com/donate/
Fr. Michael Baggot is currently a Professor Aggregato of Bioethics at the Pontifical Athenaeum Regina Apostolorum in Rome, Italy. He also serves as a professor for the Joint Diploma in Leadership: Service through Virtues. He teaches at the Catholic Worldview Fellowship summer program in Germany and Italy. He was an Adjunct Professor of Theology at the Christendom College Rome program. In addition, Baggot is a Research Scholar at the UNESCO Chair in Bioethics and Human Rights. Baggot also serves as a member of the Scholarly Advisory Board for Magisterium AI.

item.title: Terrence Sejnowski on ChatGPT and the Future of AI | Closer To Truth Chats
item.author: Closer To Truth
item.content:encoded:
Help Closer To Truth continue exploring the world's deepest questions without the need for paywalls with a tax-deductible donation of any amount: https://closertotruth.com/donate/
In "ChatGPT and the Future of AI", Terry Sejnowski offers a nuanced exploration of large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT and what their future holds. How should we go about understanding LLMs? Do these language models truly understand what they are saying? Or is it possible that what appears to be intelligence in LLMs may be a mirror that merely reflects the intelligence of the interviewer? In his book, Sejnowski, a pioneer in computational approaches to understanding brain function, answers all our urgent questions about this astonishing new technology.
Terrence Joseph Sejnowski is the Francis Crick Professor at the Salk Institute for Biological Studies where he directs the Computational Neurobiology Laboratory and is the director of the Crick-Jacobs center for theoretical and computational biology.
Watch more CTT Chats here: https://t.ly/jJI7e

item.title: Judith Wolfe - Dualism: Arguing Pros and Cons
item.author: Closer To Truth
item.content:encoded:
Shop the Closer To Truth merch store for unique items like notebooks, mugs, hoodies, and more: https://bit.ly/3P2ogje
Dualism is the theory that ultimate reality is composed of two radically different kinds of things, physical things and non-physical things, and that these same two kinds of things, expressed as body/brain and spirit/soul, account for consciousness. What are the arguments for and against Dualism (like the ‘interaction problem’)?
Make a tax-deductible donation of any amount to help support Closer To Truth continue making content like this: https://shorturl.at/OnyRq
Dr. Judith Wolfe is a Fellow in Theology at St John'sCollege in the University of Oxford. She has written widely on the interfacesbetween theology, philosophy and literature. She is General Editor of the Journal of Inklings Studies.

item.title: Holmes Rolston III - What Kind of World did God Create?
item.author: Closer To Truth
item.content:encoded:
Receive member exclusives like early access to new content by registering for a free Closer To Truth account: https://closertotruth.com/
To claim God is the Creator is to assume the burden of explaining why God selected and created this particular world. What are the characteristics of this world that could credential it as the one that the Supreme Being brought into existence? Theists do not like to argue that our world is the ‘best possible world’.
Closer To Truth is now on BlueSky! Follow us for updates, new videos, musings, and more: https://bsky.app/profile/closertotruth.bsky.social
Holmes Rolston III was an American philosopher who was University Distinguished Professor of Philosophy at Colorado State University. He is best known for his contributions to environmental ethics and the relationship between science and religion.

item.title: Timothy Pawl - Philosophy of the Bible
item.author: Closer To Truth
item.content:encoded:
Subscribe to the Closer To Truth podcast on Apple, Spotify, or wherever you listen: https://shorturl.at/mtJP4
The philosophy of fields applies analytical methods and tools of philosophy to areas of knowledge, from science and mathematics to law and aesthetics. What happens when philosophers who believe in the Bible try to construct a “philosophy of the Bible”?
Make a tax-deductible donation of any amount to help support Closer To Truth continue making content like this: https://shorturl.at/OnyRq
Timothy J. Pawl is Professor of Philosophy at the University of St. Thomas, Minneapolis. His work is in the fields of metaphysics, philosophical theology, and moral psychology. Pawl's books include "In Defense of Conciliar Christology: A Philosophical Essay" and "The Incarnation".

item.title: Ernan McMullin - Is God the Cause of a Fine-Tuned Universe?
item.author: Closer To Truth
item.content:encoded:
Follow Closer To Truth on Instagram for new videos, announcements, and more: https://www.instagram.com/closertotruth/
Our universe is astounding in that the laws of physics have to be perfect beyond belief for stars and planets, and for human beings, to even exist. Does this demonstrate, if not prove, an intelligence behind the universe, who many call God? There are other, naturalistic explanations. Can we compare natural and supernatural reasons?
Register for a free Closer To Truth membership to receive special exclusives like early access to new episodes and more: https://closertotruth.com/.
Ernan McMullin was an Irish philosopher who last served as the O’Hara Professor of Philosophy Emeritus at the University of Notre Dame. He was an internationally respected philosopher of science who has written and lectured extensively on subjects ranging from the relationship between cosmology and theology, to the role of values in understanding science, to the impact of Darwinism on Western religious thought. McMullin is the only person to ever hold the presidency of four of the major US philosophical associations.

item.title: Raymond Tallis - Can Neuroscience Alone Explain Consciousness?
item.author: Closer To Truth
item.content:encoded:
Wear your support for the show with a Closer To Truth merch purchase: https://bit.ly/3P2ogje
‘Neurophilosophy’ is the view that all that is mental or mind or consciousness can be solved ultimately by neuroscience. ‘Neuromania’ is the view that trying to explain consciousness by physical processes alone is impossible (if not ridiculous). The two views are diametrically opposed. Appreciate the arguments of each. Then decide, which is correct?
Like Closer To Truth on Facebook for daily videos, updates, announcements, and much more: https://shorturl.at/tak4l
Raymond C. Tallis is a philosopher, poet, novelist, cultural critic, and a retired medical physician and clinical neuroscientist.

item.title: Menachem Fisch - Realism vs. Anti-Realism
item.author: Closer To Truth
item.content:encoded:
Make a tax-deductible donation of any amount to help support Closer To Truth continue making content like this: https://shorturl.at/OnyRq
Does what we discover in science reflect what really exists in the world? Can science access external, independent, ultimate reality? “Realists” say Yes; “anti-realists”, No. Can we discern the ultimate reach of human knowledge? Clearly in science, but also, potentially, in theology. That’s what “critical realism” attempts to do.
Subscribe to the Closer To Truth podcast on Apple, Spotify, or wherever you listen: https://shorturl.at/mtJP4
Menachem Fisch is an Israeli philosopher. He is the Joseph and Ceil Mazer Professor Emeritus of History and Philosophy of Science, and co-Director of the Frankfurt-Tel Aviv Center for the Study of Religious and Inter-religious Dynamics at Tel Aviv University.

item.author: Closer To Truth
item.content:encoded:
Closer To Truth is now on BlueSky! Follow us for updates, new videos, musings, and more: https://bsky.app/profile/closertotruth.bsky.social
To study consciousness comprehensively and rigorously, what kinds of data or information are relevant? Data/information for Materialism theories, which are subject to the scientific method, can be well defined. But what about non-Materialism theories?

item.title: Bede Rundle - Is God Necessary?
item.author: Closer To Truth
item.content:encoded:
Get member exclusives like early access to new content with a free Closer To Truth account: https://closertotruth.com/
Whether God exists may depend on whether God is necessary. ‘Necessary’, in the philosophical sense, means ‘impossible not to exist’. Even if God exists, would it have been possible for God not to exist? Namely, even if God does exist, could it have been otherwise? If it were possible that God not exist, then why would God, as God is defined, exist at all?
Closer To Truth is now on BlueSky! Follow us for updates, new videos, musings, and more: https://bsky.app/profile/closertotruth.bsky.social
Bede Rundle is an Emeritus Fellow in Philosophy at Trinity College, Oxford. Educated in New Zealand at the Victoria University of Wellington and at Oxford, he has been a Junior Research Fellow at the Queen's College, Oxford, and has held visiting appointments in North America.

Colossal’s mission includes bringing back extinct species like the woolly mammoth and advancing conservation efforts through cutting-edge biotechnology.

item.title: Bernardo Kastrup - Panpsychism: Arguing Pro and Con
item.author: Closer To Truth
item.content:encoded:
Register for member exclusives like early access to new content with a free Closer To Truth account: https://closertotruth.com/
Panpsychism is the theory that consciousness is irreducible and exists fundamentally at the foundations of reality. Panpsychism forms include ‘micropsychism,’ where fundamental particles or fields are in some sense conscious, and ‘Cosmopsychism,’ where the entire universe is in some sense conscious. What are the arguments for and against Panpsychism like the ‘combination problem’?
Closer To Truth is now on BlueSky! Follow us for updates, new videos, musings, and more: https://bsky.app/profile/closertotruth.bsky.social
Bernardo Kastrup is a Brazilian-born Dutch philosopher and computer scientist best known for his work in the field of consciousness studies, particularly his development of analytic idealism, a form of metaphysical idealism grounded in the analytic philosophical tradition.

item.title: Marilyn Schlitz - Do Angels and Demons Exist?
item.author: Closer To Truth
item.content:encoded:
Shop the Closer To Truth merch store for unique items like notebooks, mugs, hoodies, and more: https://bit.ly/3P2ogje
Many theologians take angels and demons seriously. Why? Certainly, most human beings believe in angels and demons. Anecdotal cases are legion. Certainly, such nonphysical beings, in one form or another, populate most of the world’s religions. But angels and demons seem out of place, anachronistic, in our modern world. Is there anything here we should take seriously?
Make a tax-deductible donation of any amount to help support Closer To Truth continue making content like this: https://shorturl.at/OnyRq
Marilyn Mandala Schlitz, PhD, is a clinical research scientist, medical anthropologist, writer, speaker, thought leader, and change consultant. Her work over the past three decades explores the interface of consciousness, science, and healing.
